title: Food prices skyrocket because of Russia’s attack
itunes:title: Food prices skyrocket because of Russia’s attack
description:
The Wall Street Journal explains why Russia’s attack on Ukraine is causing the cost of food in many countries to skyrocket.

Ketanji Brown Jackson’s experience as a Supreme Court clerk two decades ago suggests that much of the current court will be familiar to her, a longtime SCOTUS-watcher writes in the Atlantic.

He was the last Afghan finance minister before the Taliban took over. Now he’s an Uber driver in America. The Washington Post tells his story.

This is the first March Madness where college athletes can strike licensing deals. Some are scoring six-figure hauls, Bloomberg Businessweek reports.
